p.s: The question that should be answered in the end of this discussion is Are the works from Shakespeare still relevant today or outdated?
So first we can say that Shakespeare's works are full of emotions like love, hate, fear, etc.
It makes the text nice to read and to understand.
The reader will get catchedcaught in the characterscharacters' feelings and in the action.

Today, theatres are still performing ShakespearesShakespeare's plays, on the one hand because of it'sits entertainment to the audience and on the other hand because of the different setting of Shakespeare's stage.
The stage is built in three parts.
Under the stage is the hell located, on the stage the earth and up to roof there's the heaven.
Additionally are Shakespeare's plays historical for the whole world of theatres.
Many actors and directors today are flashed of his work and the playwrights write down the modern plays in Shakespeare style.
The modern schools also discuss the plays of Shakespeare in class because of the historical meaning.
But there also are facts to concentrate why the play'splays of Shakespeare are outdated today.
For the first point the language of his plays is very old and hard to understand for people from the ninety and twenty century.
So young people are bored byreading Shakespeare or are not interested to read it.
Therefore, some other playwrights wrote Shakespeare's plays in modernized versions, that young people could read it.
The problem of that is that the original meaning of the text will get forgotten, so young people would think the modernised version is the original.
The choice of the different species of the modern theatres is huge.
The Shakespeare theatre could therefore be forgotten as well for many people.
To conclude this discussion it is to say that both arguments are strong enough to give the reader an own opinion.
So in my opinion the works of Shakespeare are still relevant because of the historic importance and the variety of his works.
